intro: Gethyllis bivaginata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in late winter to early spring. Gethyllis bivaginata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
